content.question:
A sociologist studying teen behavior took independent random samples of students from two high schools, F and G. Of the 80 students selected from High School F, 36 indicated they had seen a certain movie. Of the 72 students selected from High School G, 18 indicated they had seen the movie.
Which of the following is the test statistic for the appropriate test to investigate whether there is a difference in population proportions (High School F minus High School G) ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 0.45 minus 0.25 over the square root of 0.36 times 0.64, times the fraction 1 over 80 plus 1 over 72, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.45</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.36</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.64</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>72</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.45 minus 0.25 over the square root of 0.36 times 0.64, times the fraction 1 over 80 plus 72, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.45</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.36</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.64</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>72</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 0.45 minus 0.25 over the square root of 0.45 times 0.25, times the square root of the fraction 1 over 80, plus the fraction 1 over 72, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.45</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.45</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>)</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>72</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 36 minus 18 over the square root of the fraction 0.45 over 80 plus the fraction 0.25 over 72, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>36</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.45</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>72</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 36 minus 18 over the square root of the fraction 0.45 plus 0.25 over 80 plus 72, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>36</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.45</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>72</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 0.45 minus 0.25 over the square root of 0.36 times 0.64, times the fraction 1 over 80 plus 1 over 72, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.45</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>0.25</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.36</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>0.64</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>72</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.11: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
